title: Savannah candy stores open first franchise
text:
Photos Back | Next Josh Galemore/Savannah Morning News - Michael Duke eats ice cream with his dad Jeremy outside of the newly opened River Street Sweets at Tanger Outlets in Pooler. Back | Next Josh Galemore/Savannah Morning News - Harper Richards eyes shelves of candy during the grand opening of the River Street Sweets in Pooler. Back | Next Josh Galemore/Savannah Morning News - Jennifer Simmons a candy maker at the new River street Sweets in Pooler hands out pralines during the grand opening of the store located inside Tanger Outlets. Back | Next Josh Galemore/Savannah Morning News - A crowd of guests come to the new River Street Sweets franchise in Pooler inside the Tanger Outlets. By Savannah Morning News TANGER GETS SWEET DEAL
U ntil last year, River Street Sweets and Savannah’s Candy Kitchen had been friendly rivals for nearly 25 years, each successful in its own right. Siblings Jennifer and Tim Strickland operate River Street Sweets, begun by their mother in 1973. Just down the road, their father, Stan Strickland, operates Savannah’s Candy Kitchen.
In 2014, the two companies decided to join forces to offer franchise opportunities that bring together the best practices of each company.
On Friday, Glen and Liane Willard hosted the opening of the first River Street Sweets/Savannah’s Candy Kitchen franchise in Pooler’s Tanger Outlet mall. The new store will feature a variety of handmade candies, such as the group’s signature “World Famous Pralines,” old-fashioned caramel apples, homemade ice cream and chocolate loggerheads — caramel and pecans covered in chocolate to resemble a turtle.
“We chose to name the candy after the loggerhead sea turtle, a beloved and protected local species native to our coast,” Jennifer Strickland said. As a special grand-opening event, the Strickland family will match every dollar spent on loggerheads during the weekend with a donation to the Caretta Research Project, a conservation initiative to protect loggerhead sea turtles.
IF YOU GO
What: River Street Sweets/Savannah’s Candy Kitchen
Where: Tanger Outlets, 200 Tanger Outlet Blvd. #400, Pooler
Phone: 912-450-9919
Web: For more information, go to www.riverstreetcandyfranchise.com
